entry.title: Re @waitbutwhy By mass, Earth is composed of ~32% Iron. Next most common element by mass is oxygen at ~30%, but only a small portion of that is in the...
entry.summary: Re @waitbutwhy By mass, Earth is composed of ~32% Iron. Next most common element by mass is oxygen at ~30%, but only a small portion of that is in the atmosphere.

entry.title: Since I’ve been asked a lot: Buy stock in several companies that make products & services that *you* believe in. Only sell if you think their product...
entry.summary: Since I’ve been asked a lot: Buy stock in several companies that make products & services that *you* believe in. Only sell if you think their products & services are trending worse. Don’t panic when the market does. This will serve you well in the long-term.

entry.title: Re @TheCaptain_Nemo @pmarca Major problem. Passive/index managers should vote in the best interests of shareholders, not shift responsibility to proxy...
entry.summary: Re @TheCaptain_Nemo @pmarca Major problem. Passive/index managers should vote in the best interests of shareholders, not shift responsibility to proxy advisory firms.

entry.title: Re @pegobry @pmarca Exactly. Right before he died, Jack Bogle (of Vanguard fame) said index/passive funds were too great a percentage of the market an...
entry.summary: Re @pegobry @pmarca Exactly. Right before he died, Jack Bogle (of Vanguard fame) said index/passive funds were too great a percentage of the market and he really knew what he was talking about! There should be a shift back towards active investment. Passive has gone too far.

entry.title: Re @pmarca Exactly, decisions are being made on behalf of actual shareholders that are contrary to their interests! Major problem with index/passive f...
entry.summary: Re @pmarca Exactly, decisions are being made on behalf of actual shareholders that are contrary to their interests! Major problem with index/passive funds.
